curam.util.resources

Class DBtoJMS

  • java.lang.Object
    • curam.util.resources.DBtoJMS

  • public final class DBtoJMS
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides an API to initiate the database-to-JMS message transfer process.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • beginTransfer

        public static long beginTransfer()
                          throws AppRuntimeException,
                                 AppException,
                                 InformationalException
        Initiates the transfer of messages from their temporary holding table on the database to their target JMS queues. This method has two normal modes of operation:
      • Inside of application server. In this mode, a deferred process is started which triggers the transfer of messages.
      • Outside of application server. In this mode (i.e. in a batch process) the application will send a HTTP request to the application server to trigger the transfer of messages. This means that the application server must be running and, and its host address must be known.

        • A third operating mode can be specified by setting boolean property curam.batchlauncher.dbtojms.notification.test.stubtrigger. This mode is provided to facilitate debugging batch jobs which use DBtoJMS without requiring an application server to be running. Such batch jobs cause JMS messages to be stored on the database, but the messages cannot be transferred because the transfer requires an application server to be running. Therefore setting this property stubs out this method and causes it to do nothing. The pending messages can be transferred by simply starting JMSLiteEngine.

Returns:
The instance data ID of the deferred process which resulted from this call, or zero if the trigger has been stubbed out.
Throws:
AppException - ID_DBTOJMS_MUST_SPECIFY_NOTIFICATION_HOST_AND_PORT - if the properties which specify the server host name and port were not correctly specified.
InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.
AppRuntimeException - if the methods to start a deferred process or handle deferred process invocation errors cannot be found on the associated object.
AppRuntimeException - RUN_ID_DBTOJMS_ERROR_NOTIFYING_SERVER - if an error occurred notifying the server.
AppRuntimeException - RUN_ID_ERR_JMS_INIT_FAILED - if a connection or session could not be created.
AppRuntimeException - RUN_ID_ERR_JMS_NO_CONNECTION - if there is no connection to the named queue.
AppRuntimeException - RUN_ID_ERR_JMS_MESSAGE_SEND_FAILED - if the JMS service reported any errors while trying to send the message.
See Also:
JMSLiteEngine

  • isDBtoJMStraceEnabled

    public static boolean isDBtoJMStraceEnabled()
    Indicates whether tracing should be enabled for troubleshooting.
    Returns:
    true if tracing is enabled.
